alternatives.transcript: what does effective cigarette merchandising mean to today's retailer more than one might think we're here today to review the cigarette category to measure its real value to you to determine what opportunities exist and to see how you can capitalize on these opportunities

cigarettes have always been known for their ability to generate sales dollars in fact last year the cigarette category contributed 9% of all chain drug store sales and 1.4 percent of all mass retailer sales in both drugstores and mass retailers cigarettes turned 12 times a year compare this with the average health and beauty aid turn of five times a year and it's easy to see where all those cigarette dollars come from but the real force behind this

great opportunity can be described in one word profits until recently some retailers may have looked at cigarette gross margins which at 20% are not as high as margins in a number of other categories and concluded that there's not much of a bottom-line contribution from the cigarette category nothing could be further from the truth in fact cigarettes are one of the few categories which carry most of their gross profit to your bottom line

let's take the case of a carton of cigarettes in a drugstore which on average sells for thirteen dollars after taxes and cost of goods sold are deducted the retailer is left with two dollars twenty seven cents in Gross profits for cartons unlike many products cigarettes are efficiently packaged and require minimal handling so their direct product costs come to only 24 cents with substantial discounts and allowances of 35 cents which the manufacturer

is to assure product distribution and the 27 cents contributed in merchandising payments to assure product availability less a21 sent adjustment the retailer ends up with an average of $2 44 sense that he can take to the bank this profitability analysis reflects all of the costs required to support the category and hence it's true contribution to your bottom line now what does this mean to the average store

well the typical drug store sells 260 cartons of cigarettes per week or over 13,500 cartons per year multiply that by two dollars Forty Four Cents and the retailer earns nearly 33 thousand dollars in Mass retailers the impact on the bottom line is even greater the average mass retailer sells 385 cartons per week or more than 20,000 cartons per year with a cigarette probably

of $2 44 cents he earns nearly 50 thousand dollars of course cigarettes deliver even more than profits they also deliver customers by building traffic according to Popeye the point of purchase advertising Institute tobacco products generate nearly 14 purchases for every 100 customer visits to a drugstore that makes the tobacco category ranked fourth overall one of the most popular categories among shoppers

he's since cigarettes are frequently the main reason that a customer will make a shopping visit it is important to stock his or her brand research shows that cigarette customers are extremely brand loyal 50% of them will go to another store if they can't find their favorite brand out of stocks on cigarettes mean lost profit opportunities its most acute with Marlboro which accounts for one out of every four cigarette sales in that case

you lose more than just a cigarette sale you could lose a number of impulse sales which according to Popeye are worth another seven dollars 26 Cents at the check out the cigarette opportunity is one that no retailer can afford to miss out on but before you can tap into this tremendous profit potential it's important for you to recognize some of the Dynamics of the category the fastest growing new segment is the price value category

it's major appeal is that it features a distinct price or additional value to your cigarette customers this includes branded generics black-and-white generics and price off this category accounts for almost 13 percent of the market that's practically double just five years ago another major Trend taking place is growth in the proportion of cigarettes sold by the pack pack sales now account for nearly fifty five percent of total volume

that's up 40% from five years ago increase in pack share means growing category profits even without a volume increase this Improvement impact sales led by Marlborough is very important to you for two reasons first individual packs sell at a higher retail price in each pack in a carton thus contributing more to your overall sales second with the bottom line profit of 31 cents per pack and three dollars ten cents per carton

proper merchandising of packs will have a major impact on your profits Marlboro dominance and growth the growth of package sales price value cigarettes and new brands all represent major profit opportunities for you these important Trends also represent new merchandising opportunities with an effective cigarette merchandising program you can take full advantage of the profits of the cigarette category

this means selecting a highly visible and properly planogram fixture for cigarettes one that's large enough to accommodate full distribution and provide sufficient inventory depth to avoid out of stocks the number of packings required to satisfy 99% of all cigarette customers is about 230 this translates into a minimum of 260 rose on a carton rack

it's also important to make sure that all brands are properly inventoried because every out of stock costs you two dollars forty four cents in profits as well as dissatisfied customers a variety of cigarette merchandisers are available ranging from a low profile carton rack for drugstores to larger higher capacity racks and an inline shelving Department designed to meet the demands of a mass merchandiser

when merchandising the price value Brands it's best to keep them separate from the popularly price branded cigarettes special freestanding merchandisers are available that centralize all price value brands in one location these merchandisers also include signage that clearly identifies the savings available

it's important to provide a home for packs a variety of centralized package merchandisers such as Spinners are available to allow the retailer to stock all packages when he couples these with one or two smaller check Lane merchandisers he's made it very convenient for his customer to buy a pack of cigarettes

Philip Morris has a long tradition of leadership in the cigarette category with a dominant market share Philip Morris continues to grow in both share and units as the producers of Marlboro Virginia Slims Benson & Hedges Merit Cambridge and Alpine Philip Morris would like to help you set up an effective cigarette merchandising program to best suit your stores this requires you to take

advantage of new products and promotions Carton and packaged fixtures couponing programs and incentive programs because these are the tools with which you can build your cigarette business it's important that all of you reach your profit potential for more information on how to maximize your profits from the cigarette category call A Philip Morris representative today it will be a pleasure to help you
ooh merchandise cigarettes effectively and profitably

others may have looked at cigarette gross margins which at 20% are not as high as margins in a number of other categories and concluded that there's not much of a bottom-line contribution from the cigarette category nothing could be further from the truth in fact cigarettes are one of the few categories which carry most of their gross profit to your bottom line let's take the case of a carton of cigarettes in a drugstore which on average sells for thirteen dollars after taxes and cost of goods

sold are deducted the retailer is left with two dollars twenty seven cents in Gross profits for cartons unlike many products cigarettes are efficiently packaged and require minimal handling so their direct product costs come to only 24 cents with substantial discounts and allowances of 35 cents which the manufacturer pays to assure product distribution and the 27 cents contributed in merchandising payments to assure product availability

less a21 sent adjustment the retailer ends up with an average of $2 44 cents that he can take to the bank this profitability analysis reflects all of the costs required to support the category and hence it's true contribution to your bottom line now what does this mean to the average store well the typical drug store sells 260 cartons of cigarettes per week or over 13,500

per year multiply that by two dollars Forty Four Cents and the retailer earns nearly thirty three thousand dollars in Mass retailers the impact on the bottom line is even greater the average mass retailer sells 385 cartons per week or more than 20,000 cartons per year with a cigarette profit of 2.44 sense he earns nearly 50 thousand dollars of course cigarettes deliver even

I'm more than profits they also deliver customers by building traffic according to Popeye the point of purchase advertising Institute tobacco products generate nearly 14 purchases for every 100 customer visits to a drugstore that makes the tobacco category ranked fourth overall one of the most popular categories among Shoppers since cigarettes are frequently the main reason that a customer will make a shopping visit it is important to stock

his or her brand research shows that cigarette customers are extremely brand loyal 50% of them will go to another store if they can't find their favorite brand out of stocks on cigarettes mean lost profit opportunities its most acute with Marlboro which accounts for one out of every four cigarette sales in that case you lose more than just a cigarette sale you could lose a number of impulse sales which according to pop I are

worth another seven dollars 26 Cents at the check out the cigarette opportunity is one that no retailer can afford to miss out on but before you can tap into this tremendous profit potential it's important for you to recognize some of the Dynamics of the category the fastest-growing new segment is the price value category its major appeal is that it features a distinct price or additional value to your cigarette customers this includes

branded generics black-and-white generics and price off this category accounts for almost 13 percent of the market that's practically double just five years ago another major Trend taking place is growth in the proportion of cigarettes sold by the pack pack sales now account for nearly fifty five percent of total volume that's up 40% from five years ago increase in pack share means growing category profits even without a

volume increase this Improvement impact sales led by Marlborough is very important to you for two reasons first individual packs sell at a higher retail price in each pack in a carton thus contributing more to your overall sales second with the bottom line profit of 31 cents per pack and three dollars ten cents per carton the proper merchandising of packs will have a major impact on your profits Marlboro dominance and growth the

the package sales price value cigarettes and new brands all represent major profit opportunities for you these important Trends also represent new merchandising opportunities with an affected cigarette merchandising program you can take full advantage of the profits of the cigarette category this means selecting a highly visible and properly planogram fixture for cigarettes one that's large enough to accommodate

eight full distribution and provide sufficient inventory depth to avoid out of stocks the number of packings required to satisfy 99% of all cigarette customers is about 230 this translates into a minimum of 260 rose on a carton rack it's also important to make sure that all brands are properly inventoried because every out of stock costs you two dollars forty four cents in profits as

well as dissatisfied customers a variety of cigarette merchandisers are available ranging from a low profile carton rack for drugstores to larger higher capacity racks and an inline shelving Department designed to meet the demands of a mass merchandiser when merchandising the price value Brands it's best to keep them separate from the popularly price branded cigarettes special freestanding merchandisers are available that centralized

all price value brands in one location these merchandisers also includes signage that clearly identifies the savings available it's important to provide a home for packs a variety of centralized package merchandisers such as Spinners are available to allow the retailer to stock all packages when he couples these with one or two smaller check Lane merchandisers he's made it very convenient for his customer to buy a pack of cigarettes
